result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Donwin Kinder

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Matter set for a P/S on 12/22/2022 at 9:00 a.m.
Waiver of Preliminary Examination filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Donwin Kinder in court, in custody.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Mark Donwin Kinder. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:43 PM Defendant Mark Donwin Kinder appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Mark Donwin Kinder. Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for July 25, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 3
Follow all other open bond conditions.

1:12 PM Defendant Mark D Kinder appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Max Bergner appears in court on behalf of Defendant for today.
Cases heard at this time are 22GF-313, 21CF-468, 21CM-244 and 22CF-61.

Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

State requests warrants to be quashed. 

BY THE COURT:
Warrants are quashed in 21CF-468, 21CM-244 and 22CF-61.
These bonds are reinstated.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of resisting/obstructing and officer and bailjumping. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Public Defender will appoint counsel.

State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner addresses the Court regarding bond, requests signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
